column1: == Geography ==
=== Location ===
The city is located 370 km from the capital of the state (Campo Grande) and 1301 km from the state capital (Brasilia) away. The city is adjacent to Jateí
The municipality contains 21% of the 73
=== Rivers ===
The city is under the influence of the Rio Paraná
column2: the La Plata river belongs to the river system. Next Rivers:

column1: Rio Amambai: right tributary of the Paraná River.
Rio Curupaí: right tributary of the Paraná River.
Rio Ivinhema: right tributary of the Paraná River.
Rio Laranjaí: right tributary of the Rio Ivinhema.
=== Vegetation ===
The area is part of the Cerrado (savanna of central Brazil).
=== Climate ===

The city has a subtropical climate (CFA). Rainy season is between October and March. The average temperature of the coldest month is varied from 1400 to 1700 mm between 14 °C and 15 °C. The annual rainfall.
== People ==
== Religion ==
Naviraí is home to the Roman Catholic Diocese of Naviraí. The Bishop is Ettore Dotti (C.S.F.) from June 1
== Transportation ==
Naviraí is served by Naviraí Airport located 3.7 km from downtown Naviraí. There is also the bus Alternav. There is also access by federal highway BR-163
== Sports ==
Clube Esportivo Naviraiense is the municipality's football (soccer) club. They competed in the Série D in 2009. The team has had four participations in the Brazil Cup (2010
